result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon S. NELSON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver THC (>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
AODA assessment and follow through.  (If the assessment defendant has already completed is ok with the agent, the Court strikes this condition.)

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law.  Five (5) months to be served up front; Four (4) months stayed, to be imposed at agents discretion;

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 01-27-16 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
RE:  Deliver THC within 1000 feet of park, on 12-28-15.
Affidavit of Investigator Jason Erickson, Manitowoc City Police Department.
At 10:37 a.m., search warrant with return of officer thereon.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of keeper of drug house and deliver THC within 1000 feet of park.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-11-16 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no association with any known illicit drug dealers or users and maintain absolute sobriety except for any prescriptions prescribed to him and taken in correct doses.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
Search warrant issued.  RE: 1312 S. 18th Street, Manitowoc, WI occupied by Devon S. Nelson.
